com.googlecode.aluminumproject.configuration
Class DefaultConfiguration

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.aluminumproject.configuration.DefaultConfiguration
All Implemented Interfaces:
Configuration
public class DefaultConfiguration
extends Object
implements Configuration

A default configuration. It is created with a number of initialisation parameters, which determines which configuration elements will be used.

The configuration elements will be created using the default configuration element factory, although a different implementation can be used by providing a value for the "configuration.default.configuration_element_factory.class" parameter.

For the converter registry, the configuration will look for a parameter with the name "configuration.default.converter_registry.class". If the parameter exists, its value will be interpreted as the class name of the converter registry. If the parameter is absent, the converter registry will default to a default converter registry.

The template element factory is configured in the same way - if a configuration parameter with "configuration.default.template_element_factory.class" as name is present, its value will be used as template element factory class name. If the parameter is not given, a default template element factory will be used.

The default template finder and template store finder are a class path template finder and an in-memory template store finder, respectively; other implementations can be configured through the "configuration.default.template_finder.class" and "configuration.default.template_store_finder.class" parameters.

For the cache, the configuration will look for a parameter with the name "configuration.default.cache.class". If the parameter exists, its value will be interpreted as the class name of the cache. If the parameter does not exist, no cache will be used.

All other configuration elements are found by scanning one ore more packages. For each configuration element type, there is a default package in which configuration elements will be looked for. These locations can be changed by supplying configuration parameters that contain comma-separated lists of package names, both individually (the exact configuration parameters can be found in the table below) and globally (using a configuration parameter named "configuration.default.configuration_element.packages"). Configuration elements that are found through a package scan are excluded from the configuration when they are annotated with @Ignored.

Configuration elements Default package Configuration parameter
Libraries com.googlecode.aluminumproject.libraries "configuration.default.library.packages"
Parsers com.googlecode.aluminumproject.parsers "configuration.default.parser.packages"
Serialisers com.googlecode.aluminumproject.serialisers "configuration.default.serialiser.packages"
Context enrichers com.googlecode.aluminumproject.context "configuration.default.context_enricher.packages"
Expression factories com.googlecode.aluminumproject.expressions "configuration.default.expression_factory.packages"
When a parser or serialiser is found, it is named after the last part of the package it's in: this means that a parser named com.googlecode.aluminumproject.parsers.simple.SimpleParser or a serialiser named com.googlecode.aluminumproject.serialisers.simple.SimpleSerialiser will be registered under the name simple. This behaviour can be changed by annotating a parser or serialiser with @Named.

CONFIGURATION_ELEMENT_PACKAGES

public static final String CONFIGURATION_ELEMENT_PACKAGES
The name of the configuration parameter that contains a comma-separated list of packages that might contain configuration elements. Classes other than the default configuration that perform package scans are encourage to support this configuration parameter as well.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
